ygData.subject: Re: bath robes
ygData.msgSnippet: okay...when am I gonna get one of those cool bath robes?! I thought I was being really cool by traveling all the way to Freeport (got sea sick) and searched
ygData.messageBody:
okay...when am I gonna get one of those cool bath robes?! I thought I was
being really cool by traveling all the way to Freeport (got sea sick) and
searched for the ever elusive "gossamer robe". All I found was a violet SR.
apprentice robe. By the time I got back to my beloved Felwithe...I was
passe'. Everywhere I looked...everyone had one! :P

Anyone know where to buy some sharp looking wizards clothing? I've been
saving up......

Roushia of Bertoxxulous

-----Original Message-----
From: Lim Dul <sevendegrees@...>
To: eq_wizards@onelist.com <eq_wizards@onelist.com>
Date: Wednesday, June 02, 1999 2:37 PM
Subject: [eq_wizards] bath robes


>From: "Lim Dul" <sevendegrees@...>
>
>Hehe. Yup, although it won't ruin my gaming experience to keep things as
>they are...I think we are all missing out on one of the fun things about
the
>game: *looking cool* ;) I was a little dissapointed (? sorry my spelling
>is bad because I play too much :) that the one of the strongest robes we
>have to look forward to is that fluffy Observer robe that looks as if it
was
>out of the closet of Liberace. yuck!
>
>Closest thing to being visually cool I've seen is this Wizard I saw last
>night carrying a pulsing rod (forget what it was called). His wrist kept
>pulsing with a luminescent light...neat!
>
>-- Lim'Dul
>
>>- Graphical features to all Bath Robe wearers is in dire need.
>> -- You get that nice savants cap, black iron medallion, damask
>>leggings, skull of jen tra, different daggers and staff types (no new
>>graphics for them...warrior classes see differences in every
>>weapon..just about).
>
